description.en: An overview of the research history of sign systems is provided. The development of such fundamental concepts as the conception of sign, structure, binary oppositions and others in antiquity and the Middle Ages. The formation of semiotic ideas in the philosophy, psychology, linguistics and logic at the end of the 19th century and the beginning of the 20th century will be discussed. The different trends in contemporary semiotics and the works of their most notable representatives are discussed more thoroughly.
description.et: Antakse ülevaade märgisüsteemide uurimise ajaloost. Vaadeldakse fundamentaalsete mõistete nagu märk;struktuur;binaarne opositsioon jmt kujunemist antiikajast ja keskajast. Käsitletakse semiootiliste ideede teket filosoofias, psühholoogias, lingvistikas ja loogikas 19. sajandi lõpus ning 20. sajandi alguses. Erinevatele suundadele kaasaegses semiootikas ning kõige olulisemate autorite märgilistel töödel peatutakse pikemalt.

objectives.en: The course aims at providing an understanding of the nature of semiotics and his significance as a cultural force. Get an overview of formation of semiotics and its main problems and their historical development.
objectives.et: Kursus võimaldab semiootika olemuse mõistmist ning tutvustab semiootika tähtsust kultuurilise jõuna. Annab ülevaate semiootika kujunemisest ning põhimõistetest ja -ideedest kaasates nende arenguloo.

learning_outcomes.en:
By the end of the course, the students will:
 
1.	Understand the historical development of contemporary semiotics concepts.
2.	Get acquainted with the main problems in history of semiotics. 
3.	Demonstrate knowledge of semiotics, applying this to visual identity design.
4.	Demonstrate awareness of different schools of semiotics.
5.	Develop an understanding of basic concepts of semiotics. 
6.	Demonstrate creative thinking and concept development to correlate different conceptions and approaches in semiotics.

description.et:
A- theoretical texts used for the analysis relevant for the topic, the concepts used in a well-defined and understandable meaning, the argumentation clear and well-structured, the author's own synthesis original, scientifically correct presentation of the text 
B- correct use of terms, the theoretical texts used relevant for the topic, original ideas present, minor mistakes in argumentation, presentation or structuring of the text
C- the use of concepts not fully consistent, the line of argumentation tracable but further comments needed, problems with the integrity of the text 
D- the central concepts irrelevant or not well defined, larger gaps in binding different parts of the text together, the theoretical works not fully relevant, the text lacks originality 
E-the argumentation of the text hard to follow, no relevant references, the text is unstructured and the presentation does not fully follow the academic standards
F-no traces of logical argumentation, nor academic structuring principles, concerning both the form as well as the content
Will be specified for each assignment individually

description.et: What is Semiotics? Semiotics as theory of signs and methodology of sciences.
Founders of contemporary semiotics. G. Frege and meaning. Ch. S. Peirce and Semiotics. F. de Saussure and Semiology. Structuralism.
Umberto Eco. History and historiography of semiotics
Two main directions in Semiotics: substitutional and bilateral. Sign and sign system. Semiosis.
Syntactic: formal semiotics. Lexicon and Grammar. Syntagmatical, paradigmatical and hierarhical rules.
Charles Morris. Foundations of the Theory of Signs.
Semantics. Theories of Meaning: denotatum and designatum, intensional and extensional, significat and referent. Name and description.
Problem of Truth in Semiotics. Semantic representation. Metaphors. Linguistic relativity.
Pragmatics. Communication: signs and signals. R. Jakobson. Postulates of communication and presuppositions. Speech acts.
Charles S. Peirce «What is Sign ?», «Logic as Semiotics» , «On the New List of Categories»
Ferdinand de Saussure Course in General Linguistics (1 and 2 Chapters)
C. Lévi-Strauss «The Raw and the Cooked»
Semiotic hermeneutics.  Understanding and strategies of that.
